definition: to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: We're all going to be Japanese collaborators. Even the dogs you Fangs keep stand by justice and righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 我们全要做汉奸，只有你方家养的狗都深明大义的。

sentences.english: May the gods bless this grateful heart!
sentences.chinese: 愿神祗保佑这深明大义的孩子。

definition: fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to place righteousness before family (idiom); ready to punish one's own family if justice demands it
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]
